    • Constructor Detail

      • MulticlassSupportVectorMachine

        public MulticlassSupportVectorMachine(int inputs,
                              IKernel kernel,
                              int classes)
        Constructs a new Multi-class Kernel Support Vector Machine. If the number of inputs is zero, this means the machine accepts a indefinite number of inputs. This is often the case for kernel vector machines using a sequence kernel.
        Parameters:
        inputs - The number of inputs for the machine.
        kernel - The chosen kernel for the machine.
        classes - The number of classes in the classification problem.

      • MulticlassSupportVectorMachine

        public MulticlassSupportVectorMachine(KernelSupportVectorMachine[][] machines)
        Constructs a new Multi-class Kernel Support Vector Machine.
        Parameters:
        machines - The machines to be used in each of the pairwise class subproblems.

    • Method Detail

      • getMachine

        public KernelSupportVectorMachine getMachine(int class1,
                                    int class2)
        Gets the classifier for class1 against class2. If the index of class1 is greater than class2, the classifier for the class2 against class1 will be returned instead. If both indices are equal, null will be returned instead.
        Parameters:
        class1 - Class1.
        class2 - Class2.
        Returns:
        Classifier.

      • getMachinesCount

        public int getMachinesCount()
        Gets the total number of machines in this multi-class classifier.
        Returns:
        Total number of machines.

      • getClasses

        public int getClasses()
        Gets the number of classes.
        Returns:
        Number of classes.

      • getInputs

        public int getInputs()
        Gets the number of inputs of the machines.
        Returns:
        Number of inputs.

        public int Compute(double[] inputs,
          double[] responses)
        Compute.
        Parameters:
        inputs - Number of inputs.
        responses - Responses.
        Returns:
        Result.
